remarks: Separate out the first term in a finite product.  (Contributed by Scott Fenton, 24-Dec-2017.)
statement:
fprod1p.1 $e |- ( ph -> N e. ( ZZ>= ` M ) ) $.
fprod1p.2 $e |- ( ( ph /\ k e. ( M ... N ) ) -> A e. CC ) $.
fprod1p.3 $e |- ( k = M -> A = B ) $.
fprod1p $p |- ( ph -> prod_ k e. ( M ... N ) A = ( B x. prod_ k e. ( ( M + 1 ) ... N ) A ) ) $.
$d B k $.
$d M k $.
$d N k $.
$d k ph $.
